abstract: Syrian opposition begins posting photographs of prisoners who have died in government prisons so that family members can identify deceased and potentially serve as witnesses in war crimes cases; 27,000 images have been smuggled out of Syria by former police photographer, and show graphic evidence of torture.
lead_paragraph: The opposition members hope that the victims can be identified and that family members can potentially serve as plaintiffs in war crimes cases.

headline.main: Syrian Opposition to Post Dead Detainees’ Photos
headline.print_headline: Syrian Opposition to Post Dead Detainees’ Photos

snippet: The opposition members hope that the victims can be identified and that family members can potentially serve as plaintiffs in war crimes cases.

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
